title: KeySight N6841A RF Sensor Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of KeySight N6841A RF Sensor. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the configuration of Spring Framework. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in deserialization of untrusted data. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: KeySight has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.cisa.gov/uscert/ics/advisories/icsa-22-146-01
timeline:
2021-12-30 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-05-27 - Coordinated public release of advisory
